text: Ganwa is the name for the princely group that traditionally ruled Burundi. They formed a distinct social class that was neither Hutu nor Tutsi, although some nevertheless considered them to be a sub-branch of the latter. Civil Wars of the World: Major Conflicts Since World War II, Volume 1 page 205 They have launched several appeals to be recognized as a distinct socio-cultural grouping. ==References== Category:African traditional governments Category:Ethnic groups in Burundi Category:African dynasties
title: Ganwa
